Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Immigration Compliance and Enforcement - London and South
Job/Team Function: "Area Director for the London and South of England responsible for the delivery of enforcement activity and performance within the region; Delivering the regional business plan; leadership of and responsibility for immigration compliance & enforcement teams (ICEs) across the command; Developing and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external corporate partners; Leading the command to support the reform of central processing functions in accordance with the Immigration Enforcement Operating Model.  The Areal Director also has responsibility for enhancing the regions profile, identity and culture. He acts as an ambassador for the region."

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Immigration Compliance & Enforcement - North, Midlands and Wales
Job/Team Function: Area Director for the North, Midlands and Wales responsible for the delivery of enforcement activity and performance within the region; Delivering the regional business plan; leadership of and responsibility for immigration compliance & enforcement teams (ICEs) across the command; Developing and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external corporate partners; Leading the command to support the reform of central processing functions in accordance with the Immigration Enforcement Operating Model.  The Areal Director also has responsibility for enhancing the regions profile, identity and culture. He acts as an ambassador for the region.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Criminal Investigations and Central Operations
Job/Team Function: "Home Office Criminal Investigation Teams are responsible for tackling immigration crime at the border and inland with a particular focus on organised immigration crime. They have a criminal and financial investigations capability, combining crime teams at the border and in regional offices across the UK using specially trained immigration officers, financial investigators and seconded police officers to disrupt organised criminal groups. By working in an integrated way with law enforcement agencies at home and abroad, particularly the National Crime Agency, Border Police Command, we will maximise our strengths and develop our capability to deal with the full range of immigration offences. Our priorities are to tackle all forms of human trafficking, facilitation and the production and supply of false or forged documentation."

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Immigration Compliance and Enforcement - Scotland & Northern Ireland
Job/Team Function: The Director for Scotland and Northern Ireland is responsible for managing immigration enforcement activity in Scotland & Northern Ireland in cooperation with other law enforcement agencies and for the coordination of all Home Office activity in Scotland and Northern Ireland. The postholder is also responsible for advising on devolution issues and maintaining relations with the Scottish and Northern Ireland Assembly Governments. The postholder is the Senior Responsible Owner for immigration related engagement in the Glasgow Commonwealth Games 2014.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: "Responsible for the deportation of Foreign National Offenders from the United Kingdom.  The Directorate’s objective is to protect the public by deporting foreign nationals who commit serious criminal offences, where legislation permits, and to actively monitor and manage Foreign National Offenders (FNOs) released into the community pending deportation. It does this by rigorously pursuing deportation against foreign offenders who meet our criteria, managing each case through the legal process, negotiating barriers such as travel documents and ensuring that the use of immigration detention is appropriate. Asylum, remand; custody and non-detained teams provide specialist service to these key cohorts. A further 90 IE staff are embedded in prisons nationwide."

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the removal of cases detained by the Immigration Compliance & Enforcement Teams across the Country.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: "Director for Removals and Compliance Casework with responsibility for strengthening compliance amongst migrants by contacting those who may not have a right to be here and ensuring they either regularise their stay or leave the UK. Responsibility for management of a contract with Capita for contact management and casework. Those who will not depart voluntarily will be tasked onto ICE teams for enforced removal. Specific teams will focus on elements of this work - families, core casework, and compliance."

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading a programme of work on removals integration. The work involves exploring new ways of working and alternative delivery models to increase capacity and capability and deliver efficiencies in the longer term.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for professional standards of operational intelligence in IE; intelligence policy, guidance, compliance and provision of intelligence training; liaison with UK law enforcement; advice on document fraud and forgery trends, in-depth forensic examination of suspect documents and provision of document fraud and forgery training

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: "The Director of Returns is responsible for the holding individuals subject to detention under immigration legislation safely and securely, for enforcing their removal from the UK when the appropriate arrangements have been made, to ensure routes are maintained for removals, for the provision of electronic monitoring where it is made a requirement for those released on bail and for operating a programme to assist the departure of irregular migrants and failed asylum seekers who wish to leave the UK voluntarily."

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Working with partners within the Home Office and other government departments, the Director of the Interventions and Sanctions Unit is responsible for the development and systematic application of a range of sanctions in order to deny access to public and financial services by those who are not entitled, thereby removing incentives for people to stay in the UK illegally and encouraging those who remain here unlawfully to regularise their stay or to depart voluntarily.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for implementation of strategy, business planning, stakeholder engagement and corporate enablers.

Name: N/D

Name: Mike Parsons
Job/Team Function: Capabilities & Resources is critical to ensuring that operational and policy teams in the Home Office have the support they need to deliver the department’s priorities of preventing terrorism, cutting crime and reducing immigration while at the same time contributing to the government’s growth agenda. The group also works closely with other enabler functions to provide a joined-up enabling function to support operational delivery.

Name: Simon Wren
Job/Team Function: Director of Communications / 'Leads the delivery of external and internal communications for the Home Office, working with the Secretary of State, Ministers and senior officials to provide leadership and advice on communications to support policy and departmental objectives. The Directorate is responsible for providing specialist services in media handling, strategic communications/marketing, digital, internal communications, insight/research and a correspondence service for the public and MPs.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of Digital Communications / The Digital Communications Unit is responsible the delivery, maintenance and improvement of the Home Office’s internal and external digital communications channels. The unit creates and updates/maintains content for all channels including GOV.UK, the Home Office intranet and social media channels. The unit also produces graphics and video content.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Strategic Communications, Marketing and Insight
Job/Team Function: Head of Strategic Communications, Marketing and Insight develops the Home Office communication strategy and then delivers the necessary attitude and behaviour change campaigns that help the Department deliver its priorities, or defend its reputation.  The Unit undertakes quantitative and qualitative research, surveys and social media monitoring . This ensures campaigns are grounded in evidence and insight and are robustly evaluated. We operate domestically and globally, with staff based in China, India and the Gulf.  We use third parties to undertake face to face communications to migrants across the Horn of Africa, Afghanistan and northern France.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of News (Press Office / Visits and Events) / The Press Office is responsible for all press and media handling activities within the Home Office and acts as the spokesperson for the Home Secretary. Leading the Press Office, the Head of News helps to develop and deliver effective media handling strategies and support to Ministers and policy teams as well as proactive media handling strategies. The Ministerial Visits and Events team develops and delivers visits and events designed to support communication and ministerial objectives, focused on gaining original media coverage or strengthening relationships with key influencers and audience groups. Visits managers for each Minister and the Home Secretary arrange and accompany on visits and events and organise high-profile conferences and speeches where there is ministerial involvement.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Internal Communications, Staff Engagement and Professional Development
Job/Team Function: Head of internal communication is responsible for co-ordinating communications to all of our 30,000 staff in both operational and HQ roles in the UK and internationally and developing and delivering the internal element of the Home Office’s communication strategy. The unit supports our senior leaders in setting out the vision for the department, providing channels for two-way conversations with our staff that raise awareness, promote engagement and drive behaviours to deliver departmental objectives.

Name: Fiona Spencer
Job/Team Function: The post holder is responsible for oversight of the Home Office change investment portfolio, including leading development of the department's investment strategy, ensuring effective project delivery and optimising return on investment. This also currently includes the role of Senior Responsible Officer for the Smarter Working programme, a GMPP level major project. The Chief Portfolio Officer is also head of profession for project delivery within the Home Office, leading development of professional project delivery capability in the department and, as a member of the cross-government profession steering group, in supporting wider development of the project delivery profession across government.
Notes: Included salary costs for HR10 and 1CS49

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director, Portfolio and Project Delivery
Job/Team Function: The post-holder is responsible for leading work on portfolio management, project delivery assurance and capability across the Home Office, as the Home Office Centre of Excellence for project delivery.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Smarter Working Programme is part of a range of departmental initiatives relating to wider Civil Service Reform. It aims to deliver greater efficiency and effectiveness and achieve a department where people: focus on outcomes not process; are empowered by technology; work flexibly and cost-effectively; collaborate more effectively with other teams and departments; and maximise productivity and innovation. A better use of the department's estate will also assist the necessary expenditure and carbon reductions the Home Office will need to achieve in the coming years.

Name: Richard Hornby
Job/Team Function: The Finance and Estates Directorate plays a key role in ensuring that the Home Office gets the most from its resources and provides cost-effective financial advice and support to Ministers, the Department and key stakeholders to enable them to deliver the Home Office objectives. It aims to minimise demands on our businesses, improve financial processes and systems, drive out inefficiencies and support delivery across all areas of the Home Office Group.
Notes: Includes salary costs for 1CS18, 1CS45 and 1CS44 and 3CS01

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Financial Planning Unit is responsible for securing the forward finances of the Home Office, including developing and securing cabinet and parliamentary clearance of the immigration and visa fees package. FPU is also responsible for ensuring those resources are applied to ministerial priorities in a way that maximises value for money. This includes  advice on investment decisions and the investment approval process; and management of contract finance across the department.

Name: N/D
Job Title: HM Passport Office Senior Finance Business Partner
Job/Team Function:
The HM Passport Office Senior Finance Business Partner is responsible for supporting these business areas in strategic and tactical decision making, ensuring financial consequences, risks and opportunities are understood and considered at the point at which decisions are taken; providing professional challenge to the business, ensuring financial plans, forecasts and underlying assumptions are robust and are appropriately tested; and working on behalf of the business to commission and oversee the delivery of expert financial support and advice from other areas of finance to time and quality in order to meet business objectives.
In addition the unit manages both European grant funding  and Finance Professionalism and Capability.
Unit: HM Passport Office Finance Business Partner Unit
Notes: Finance Professionalism & Capability Unit also reports to Paul Darling and FTE figures are included here.

Job Title: Border Force Senior Finance Business Partner

Job/Team Function: The Commercial Directorate provides strategic commercial and procurement capability across the Home Office Group. It provides strategic commercial advice and capability. It develops, maintains and manages Group-wide relationships with suppliers, and the wider public sector, and contributes to cross Home Office and Government Commercial and IT goals to introduce significant efficiencies and savings. The Chief Commercial Officer leads the procurement profession across the Group.
Notes: salary costs for all staff under 2CS02 included here

Job/Team Function: The Performance Reporting and Analysis Unit is responsible for providing an independent view on performance and risk to the Home Office Board.  The Unit is also responsible for providing performance reporting and analysis on the border, immigration and passport operations to inform their management of the business and to answer requests for information (including in relation to Parliamentary Questions, Freedom of Information requests, briefings and policy advice).  The Unit produces visual and insightful reports to support decision-making, and plays a key role in developing analysis-driven solutions to improve operational performance.

Job Title: HO Data Analytics Capability Programme Director
Job/Team Function:
The HO Data Analytics Capability  is a business change programme that delivers a Data Analytics capability to drive an intelligence-led organisation, in order to help make our communities safer and improve the public’s customer experience of interacting with the HO.

The objective of the Information Digitisation Programme is to break the department’s dependency on paper based transactions by delivering bespoke digital projects, in certain key areas, which prove concepts and demonstrate capability.  Successful projects should  have potential to empower the HO, its staff and customers to operate more effectively, efficiently and securely in a digital age.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Digital Delivery is in the process of delivering 25 projects, ranging from a discovery for Police.uk to an alpha for Immigration and Enforcement Ticketing and Escorting and Beta for HMPO Online Passport renewals. Projects vary in scale and impact across departments. Digital Delivery sets standards and governance for digital services. Digital Delivery are setting quality standards to be shared across the Home Office to determine and build understanding of ‘what good looks like’ across each of the above functions.

Name: Bernard Silverman
Job/Team Function: “The task of the Chief Scientific Adviser (CSA) is to provide personal independent scientific advice and support of the highest quality to the Home Secretary and other Home Office ministers and officials on the whole range of Home Office policies and operations. The CSA participates in the Executive Management Board, and reports direct to the Permanent Secretary.  Other important elements of the CSA role includes providing the highest quality independent scientific scrutiny and challenge to departmental decisions; fostering relations with other government departments, academia and industry, both in the UK and abroad; and overseeing the landscape of the Department's Research and Development.”

Name: Alan Pratt
Job Title: Director of Science Engineering and Technology
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Science, Engineering and Technology provides strategic oversight of the Home Office’s physical and social science teams. They also have responsibility for scientific regulatory functions, the delivery of the National DNA Database service, and the shared support for Home Office Science teams and independent advisory committees. As the Head of Profession for scientists and engineers in the Home Office they work as part of a cross-Government network to ensure specialist scientific skills are developed and used effectively.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Senior Biometrics Adviser provides advice to those projects and programmes in the Home Office, its agencies and law enforcement organisations which make use of biometrics for identity assurance, securing of borders and the prevention and the investigation of crime – from development of policy to procurement and deployment. The SBA offers independent assurance on programme feasibility, risk management and value for money. The Adviser leads on national and international standards within the Home Office, and is the interface to the supplier, integrator and academic communities, ensuring a coherent forward view on the application of biometrics in a privacy-respecting context.'
Unit: Office of the Senior Biometrics Advisor

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief Statistician and Head of Profession for Statistics
Job/Team Function: The Chief Statistician’s Unit is responsible for National Statistics publications on Scientific Procedures on Animals; Firearm Certificates; and Alcohol Licensing and three Official Statistics publications on the police use of tasers, deployment of firearms by the police, football banning orders and Fire Statistics. These support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, performance management and meet the needs of Parliament and the wider public. The Chief Statistician reports to the National Statistician with respect to all professional matters and also has lead analytical strategic responsibility for a number of areas including Knowledge Management, Data collection, storage, handling, analysis and use across the Home Office.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST)
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST) provides expert advice, innovation and frontline support for the Home Office and its agencies on any issue relating to science and technology. CAST supports the full range of Home Office priorities in the areas of policing and tackling crime, counter terrorism, border security and controlling immigration. CAST only operate where others cannot for reasons of impartiality, national security or market failure.'
Unit: The Centre for Applied Science & Technology

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief Inspector, Head of Unit - Animals in Science Regulation Unit
Job/Team Function: The Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU) comprises the policy, licensing and inspectorate staff responsible for administering the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) and related regulations.  The Policy Team advises ministers on issues related to ASPA and responds to correspondence (including PQs and FOI enquiries) from MPs and the public.  Inspectors (all registered medical or veterinary practitioners) provide advice on applications to the Licensing Team who grant the licences on behalf of the Secretary of State.  Inspectors also visit registered establishments to check for non-compliance and provide advice on applications and good practice. The majority of visits are unannounced.'
Unit: The Animals in Science Regulation Unit
